intro: Knautia arvensis var. glandulifera, commonly known as the glandular knautia, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its hairy stems and leaves are distinctive features, and it is often used in gardens for its ornamental value. The variety glandulifera is distinguished by its glandular hairs, which give it a unique appearance and help in identifying it from other Knautia species.
